transcript:
Patient: Implementing the thought records and behavioral activation exercises has been challenging, but also enlightening. I've noticed that I tend to have a lot of negative self-talk, especially when it comes to work. I often think things like "I'm not good enough" or "I'll never be able to handle this workload."

Therapist: It's great that you've been able to identify these negative thoughts. That's an important first step in the thought challenging process. Can you walk me through a specific situation where you noticed these thoughts coming up?

Patient: Sure. Just the other day, I was at work and my manager asked me to take on an additional project. My initial thought was, "I can't handle this. I'm already struggling with my current workload." I felt overwhelmed and anxious.

Therapist: Thank you for sharing that example. Let's apply the thought challenging technique to this situation. What evidence do you have that supports the thought "I can't handle this"?
